intro: Hylodesmum oldhamii f. album, commonly known as the white-flowered rockrose, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Cistaceae and is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit. The plant features small, white flowers that bloom in clusters, often during the spring and summer months. Its leaves are typically small, narrow, and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in its arid habitat. Hylodesmum oldhamii f. album is well adapted to rocky and coastal environments, thriving in well-drained soils.
